document.docAuthor: Chani-Posse, Mariana, Newton, Alfred F., Hansen, Aslak Kappel & Solodovnikov, Alexey
document.masterDocTitle: Checklist and taxonomic changes for Central and South American Philonthina (Coleoptera: Staphylinidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Checklist and taxonomic changes for Central and South American Philonthina (Coleoptera: Staphylinidae)

bibRefCitation.refString: Sharp, D. (1885) Staphylinidae. Biologia Centrali-Americana. Insecta. Coleoptera, 1 (2), 393 - 536. [http: // www. sil. si. edu / digitalcollections / bca /]

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Paederomimus
Sharp 1885 : 438
–439. Type species:
Paederomimus difformiceps Sharp, 1885
, by original designation.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Notes:
Paederomimus
is the most diverse and widely distributed genus among the Neotropical endemic genera, accounting for 58 species at present. Sharp (1885) erected the genus for 39 species, some of which were organized into three species groups. Never revised after its original description, other species were later described and/or assigned to this genus (see references below) whose monophyly is currently doubtful (Chani- Posse et al. 2018). The only available hypothesis of monophyly known at present is that provided by Sharp (1885: 439) who stated “3. A group for which, if the genus be divided, the name
Paederomimus
be retained, and of which
P. difformiceps
may be taken as type ”. Within the context of this study we find adequate to orientate the readers through the study of this genus by doing remarks into those species that fulfill Sharp´s concept of his
Paederomimus
group 3.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Philonthus abactus
Sharp 1876a : 177
. Type locality: Ega. Type depository: BMNH HT. Distribution : Brazil ( Amazonas )
. Note: comb. nov. ex
Philonthus (

)
; distribution within Brazil (Asenjo et al. 2013).

)

)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Comment. Not
Paederomimus
group 3 ( Sharp 1885: 439 ), to be placed in a further study.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Comment. Not
Paederomimus
group 3 ( Sharp 1885: 439 ), to be placed in a further study.

of
